intro: Cacalia leiocarpa, commonly known as the whitehead evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the tribe Phrymaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
